entities: United Nations Mission for the Referendum in Western Sahara
reporting_cycle: Secretary-General reports before the end of the present mandate
summary:
The Security Council:
Recalling previous resolutions on Western Sahara, particularly resolution 1495 (2003), reaffirms its commitment to assist parties in achieving a just, lasting, and mutually acceptable political solution for the self-determination of Western Sahara's people. 
Reaffirms support for the Peace Plan for Self-Determination as an optimum solution based on an agreement between parties. 
Supports the Secretary-General's and his Personal Envoy's efforts to achieve a mutually acceptable solution. 
Calls on parties and regional States to cooperate with the Secretary-General and his Envoy. 
Extends the MINURSO mandate until 31 October 2004. 
Requests a report from the Secretary-General on the situation before the mandate ends, including an evaluation of the necessary mission size. 
Decides to remain seized of the matter.
